intro: Orthoceras solandri, commonly known as the Solander's orthoceras, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
